item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 1
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description: so, i uninstalled my previous bundle using the instructions found on the mac osx page, and then installed this version, and it is not working. No application image for vidalia ever showed up in the application folder, the settings didn't work when i used the old application launcher (which i eventually erased in a desperate attempt to uninstall everything related to get a fresh start), and i am generally aggravated because i am not that good with figuring this kind of stuff out

item.title: phobos: Comment 2
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: I need more details to help you out. You should open a bug report at https://bugs.torproject.org. We'll need the relevant bits of the file /var/log/install.log.

item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 5
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description:
Hi,
it's an older thread,but i have a question:
is it normal to have a server with tor 1.2.19 in my 0.2.1.19 state-file.
usual?

greets

item.title: phobos: Comment 6
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: Yes, we haven't cut out the 1.x releases from the network yet.

item.title: Anonymous (not verified): Comment 7
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous (not verified)
item.description:
"On September 13th, 2009 phobos said:
Yes, we haven't cut out the 1.x releases from the network yet."

What means that?

tor-ChangeLog:
Changes in version 0.2.0.34 - 2009-02-08
This release marks end-of-life for Tor 0.1.2.x.

item.title: phobos: Comment 8
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description:
End of life means no more updates or patches. It's a dead branch, stop running it.

Soon we will stop allowing 1.x clients onto the network.
